name: National Association of Environmental Professionals
description:
History: National Association of Environmental Professionals (NAEP) Texas A&M Student Chapter was founded and established in 1992.

Purpose: The Texas A&M University Student Chapter of the National Association of Environmental Professionals (TAMU NAEP) has been established in order to:

  1. Provide a forum for students, faculty, and staff with varied backgrounds to exchange information, ideas, and experiences.
  2. Promote the advancement of the state-of-the-art in interdisciplinary environmental education, research, planning, assessment, review, and management.
  3. Promote an on-campus awareness of pertinent environmental issues and ideas that affect natural resources and peoples at the local, regional, national, and international levels.
  4. Stimulate students to pursue greater knowledge and appreciation of the complex environmental issues facing the areas surrounding the university and the entire country through lectures, seminars, and field activites.
  5. Provide an opportunity for students to interact with local practicing Environmental Professionals to better understand the application of our education.

Mission Statement: Our mission is to develop Texas A&M students professionally and prepare them for employment in the environmental field. We are a multidisciplinary organization dedicated to the promotion of green jobs, professionalism, and academic excellence.

General Information: Speakers from all sectors of the environmental field volunteer time to talk about their day-to-day experience, provide career and interviewing advice, and offer networking that may lead to future employment or internship opportunities.

  • We accept new members year round, and welcome you to join us for pizza and drinks!
  • Dues are $25/academic year or $20/semester.
  • Speaker suggestions and questions or comments may be directed to our email address: naep.tamu@gmail.com
  • We welcome you to check out the national organization site at naep.org and encourage you to become a member.

Meetings are held the 1st and 3rd Tuesday of every month at 7 pm in Peterson 113.

*Peterson is adjacent to Sterling C. Evans Library and the Student Computing Complex on Main Campus.
summary: Our mission is to develop Texas A&M students professionally and prepare them for employment in the environmental field. We are a multidisciplinary organization dedicated to the promotion of green jobs, professionalism, and academic excellence.
